item.description:
UPDATE 07/02: The Greenway Challenge has announced some of the details for the 2011 Challenge.  While the final course will not be announced until two weeks before the race, they have let us know where we are starting, what we are doing, and where we will be finishing.

Start: Lincoln Woods State Park in Lincoln, RI

Segments: There will be eight segments covering about 56.2 miles.

  1. 5.5 mile road run
  2. 2.6 mile river paddle
  3. 19.5 mile road ride
  4. 6.0 mile road run
  5. 2.6 mile river paddle
  6. 14.0 mile road ride
  7. 3.1 mile trail run
  8. 2.9 mile lake paddle

Finish: Wallum Lake in Douglas State Park in Douglas, MA

Click here if you need to register your team

=====

Team Random Greatness will be competing in three different team relays in 2011 and would love to have others from the different local meetup groups form their own teams to compete in these events with us.

The Great Race and the Josh Billings are your basic, three-segment team relay races - they have a paddle (lake kayak), peddle (road bike), and plod (road run) while the Greenway Challenge strings together 6 - 10 segments that could also include a river paddle, a mountain bike peddle, or a trail plod.

  • The Great Race XXXIV on August 14, 2011 in Auburn, NY. This will be our first year competing in this race. We will be in the traditional kayak race that consists of a 6.2 mile run, a 19.5 mile road bike, and a 4.0 mile lake paddle. Click here for more information about the great race.  
  • The 35th Josh Billings RunAground on September 18, 2011 in Lenox, MA. This will be our fourth year competing in this race - in 2010 we finished 3rd out of 17 teams in the Mixed Over 40 category and 140th out of 435 teams overall. We will be in the kayak race that consists of a 27.0 mile road bike, a 5.0 mile lake paddle, and a 6.2 mile run. Click here for more information about the josh billings.  
  • The 11th Blackstone River Valley Greenway Challenge on September 24, 2011 in Worcester, MA. This will be our fifth year competing in this race - in 2010 we finished 5th out of 38 teams in the all-ages category and 15th out of 68 teams overall. While the course won't be announced until next year (it changes every year), the 2010 course covered about 55 miles and had seven different segments: 4.3 mile run, 20.8 mile road bike, 4.8 mile river paddle, 5.0 mile mountain bike, 17.0 mile road bike, 5.8 mile run, and a 1.6 mile lake paddle.  Click here for more information about the greenway challenge.  

Let me know if I can answer any questions or help out in any way if you want to put a team together (or if you are an iron person and are looking to go solo). If you would like to be part of a team indicate in your RSVP what part of the race you would like to do and maybe we can piece together a team or two.
item.name: The 11th Greenway Challenge Team Triathlon Relay Race
